recipe_name: Sautéed apples with whisky and orange
author: Phil Vickery
method: Heat the sugar, apple slices and vanilla seeds in a frying pan over a medium heat until caramelised. Add the orange zest and juice, whisky and sultanas and simmer for a few minutes, until the apple is softened. To serve, place the apples onto a serving plate with a dollop of yoghurt and a sprig of mint, to garnish.
ingredients: 50g/2oz caster sugar,  2 Cox apples, peeled, cored and sliced,  1 vanilla pod, seeds scraped out,  1 orange, zest and juice only,  ¼ whisky miniature ,  50g/2oz sultanas,  2 tbsp Greek-style yoghurt,  sprig fresh mint
